column4: I installed a timer-applet, but it doesn't show up in Applications.
I did whereis timer-applet, and found some of the files
What kind of file is the equivalent of the .exe. file in Windows?
nothing
you chmod +x it
file extentions are just names... so linux ignores them
you chmod +x a file to make it executable
but of course it has to be a binary file in the first place...
then what do you mean by application
alacarte
what the command line would be to start it, as opposed to clicking on it in the Application dropdown menu
even though, the command line for a program IS the program
mine is a dropup
e.g. Firefix would be firefox
type
typ
TYPO
i type so bad sometimes i can't even spell typo right
well the O key fell off... and the P is loose
cheap laptop
:P
mdg: It seems there should be a straightforward way to know the command for any application???
